Aula1

Author

Ana Carolyne

Introdução: algumas funções básicas do R

A <- c(1:10)
B <- c(11:20)

DF <- data.frame(A, B)

is.data.frame(A) #resposta no console ([1] FALSE)
[1] FALSE
is.data.frame(DF) #resposta no console ([1] TRUE)
[1] TRUE

Pacote agricolae

library(agricolae)

dates <- c(14, 21, 28) #days

# example a: evaluation - vector
evaluation <- c(40, 80, 90)
audpc(evaluation, dates)
evaluation 
      1015 
library(epifitter)

pressure
   temperature pressure
1            0   0.0002
2           20   0.0012
3           40   0.0060
4           60   0.0300
5           80   0.0900
6          100   0.2700
7          120   0.7500
8          140   1.8500
9          160   4.2000
10         180   8.8000
11         200  17.3000
12         220  32.1000
13         240  57.0000
14         260  96.0000
15         280 157.0000
16         300 247.0000
17         320 376.0000
18         340 558.0000
19         360 806.0000
summary(pressure)
  temperature     pressure       
 Min.   :  0   Min.   :  0.0002  
 1st Qu.: 90   1st Qu.:  0.1800  
 Median :180   Median :  8.8000  
 Mean   :180   Mean   :124.3367  
 3rd Qu.:270   3rd Qu.:126.5000  
 Max.   :360   Max.   :806.0000  
plot(pressure)
str(pressure) #str : mostra a estrutura do df
'data.frame':   19 obs. of  2 variables:
 $ temperature: num  0 20 40 60 80 100 120 140 160 180 ...
 $ pressure   : num  0.0002 0.0012 0.006 0.03 0.09 0.27 0.75 1.85 4.2 8.8 ...

Para adicionar mais uma coluna no dataframe:

df <- data.frame(cars)

df$dist2 <- log(df$dist)
df$dist2 <- c(1:50)

# Usando o tidyverse:

library(tidyverse)

df|>
  mutate(dist3 = dist2+1)
   speed dist dist2 dist3
1      4    2     1     2
2      4   10     2     3
3      7    4     3     4
4      7   22     4     5
5      8   16     5     6
6      9   10     6     7
7     10   18     7     8
8     10   26     8     9
9     10   34     9    10

11    11   28    11    12

14    12   24    14    15
15    12   28    15    16

17    13   34    17    18
18    13   34    18    19
19    13   46    19    20

24    15   20    24    25

Para selecionar colunas específicas do DF:

df |> 
  select(speed)
   speed
1      4
2      4
3      7
4      7
